importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of publication indicates the most recent update to the news story, highlighting the current status and public awareness of Doug Martin's death.

The date of the incident (Saturday, prior to publication) is critical because it marks when the events leading to Doug Martin's death occurred, providing context for the timeline of the break-in and arrest.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame of the incident (early Saturday) is significant as it indicates when the arrest occurred and when Martin became unresponsive, which is central to understanding the sequence of events leading to his death.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro NFL running back, died after being taken into custody during a break-in investigation in Oakland.
Martin, originally from Oakland and known for his career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, struggled with mental health issues that impacted his life and contributed to the incident.
The incident began when Martin, reportedly overwhelmed and disoriented, fled his home and entered a neighbor’s house, leading to his arrest.
Police reported a brief struggle during the arrest, and Martin became unresponsive and died in hospital after being transported by paramedics.
An autopsy will be conducted to determine the cause of death, which remains undisclosed.
The case is being investigated by multiple agencies, including Oakland Police, city police commission, community police review agency, and county district attorney’s office.

Martin’s former agent described his mental health struggles as a major factor in the events that led to his death, emphasizing that mental illness was the 'one opponent from which Doug could not run'.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro NFL running back known for his career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died after being taken into custody during a break-in investigation in Oakland. Police reported a brief struggle during his arrest, and he became unresponsive and later died in a hospital. Martin, originally from Oakland and raised in Stockton, had a history of mental health challenges, which his former agent described as a significant factor in the events leading to his death. The case is under investigation by multiple agencies, including the Oakland Police Department and Alameda County Coroner’s Office. The incident has prompted public mourning, especially from the community and the Buccaneers, which recognized his impact on their franchise history. A cause of death has not been released, and an autopsy is underway.
title: Former NFL Star Doug Martin Dies After Arrest in Oakland Break-In Investigation
